title: Merge Two Sorted Lists
description:
You are given the heads of two sorted linked lists list1 and list2. Merge the two lists into one sorted list by splicing together the nodes of the first two lists. Return the head of the merged linked list.

Example:
  Input: list1 = [1,2,4], list2 = [1,3,4]
  Output: [1,1,2,3,4,4]

Constraints:
- The number of nodes in both lists is in the range [0, 50]
- -100 <= Node.val <= 100
- Both lists are sorted in non-decreasing order
test_code:
require 'minitest/autorun'
require_relative 'solution'

def to_linked(arr)
  head = nil
  arr.reverse.each { |v| head = ListNode.new(v, head) }
  head
end

def to_array(head)
  result = []
  while head
    result << head.val
    head = head.next_node
  end
  result
end

class TestMergeTwoSortedLists < Minitest::Test
  def test_basic
    assert_equal [1,1,2,3,4,4], to_array(merge_two_lists(to_linked([1,2,4]), to_linked([1,3,4])))
  end
  def test_both_empty
    assert_equal [], to_array(merge_two_lists(nil, nil))
  end
  def test_one_empty
    assert_equal [0], to_array(merge_two_lists(nil, to_linked([0])))
  end
end
